item.title: Fixxed
item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

You’re getting errors because like I said before, I renamed variables so if an outside developer looked at the code, they’d have a slightly better idea of what the variable was for. For the second piece of code, add it into the enterRFD method as a little check for yourself.

Read full topic

item.title: Fixxed
item.dc:creator: @nickskeee nickskeee
item.description:
@nickskeee wrote:

[quote=“Null Amount, post:18, topic:533674”]I edited it for you so it looks a bit cleaner, I’ve renamed some variables so you replace your old ones. public void enterRFD() { if (c.killedCulinaromancer == true) { c.sendMessage("You have already finished the minigame."); return; } if (c.killedAgrith == true && c.killedFlambeed == false) { c.waveId = 1; } else if (c.killedFlambeed == true && c.killedKaramel == false) { c.waveId = 2; } else if (c.killedKaramel == true && c.killedDessourt == false) { c.waveId = 3; } else if (c.killedDessourt == true && c.killedCulinaromancer == false) { c.waveId = 4; } else if (c.killedAgrith == false) { c.rfdToKill = -1; c.rfdKilled = -1; } c.getPA().movePlayer(1899, 5363, c.playerId * 4 + 2); Server.rfd.spawnNextWave(c); }Just add a little check that the enterRFD method is even being called System.out.println("This is working!");
Add that and when you talk to the Gypsy, see if that line gets printed.[/quote]

If i use the clean code i get 12 errors and where do i put second code in ?

Read full topic

item.title: Fixxed
item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

I edited it for you so it looks a bit cleaner, I’ve renamed some variables so you replace your old ones. public void enterRFD() { if (c.killedCulinaromancer == true) { c.sendMessage("You have already finished the minigame."); return; } if (c.killedAgrith == true && c.killedFlambeed == false) { c.waveId = 1; } else if (c.killedFlambeed == true && c.killedKaramel == false) { c.waveId = 2; } else if (c.killedKaramel == true && c.killedDessourt == false) { c.waveId = 3; } else if (c.killedDessourt == true && c.killedCulinaromancer == false) { c.waveId = 4; } else if (c.killedAgrith == false) { c.rfdToKill = -1; c.rfdKilled = -1; } c.getPA().movePlayer(1899, 5363, c.playerId * 4 + 2); Server.rfd.spawnNextWave(c); }Just add a little check that the enterRFD method is even being called System.out.println("This is working!");
Add that and when you talk to the Gypsy, see if that line gets printed.

Read full topic

item.title: Fixxed
item.dc:creator: @nickskeee nickskeee
item.description:
@nickskeee wrote:

[quote=“Null Amount, post:16, topic:533674”][quote author=nickskeee link=topic=652469.msg4371994#msg4371994 date=1380925333]
ok everything is in place and no errors but last problem gypsy doesn’t teleport me :s
[/quote]Is the enterRFD method the one for teleportation? Post that one if it is.[/quote]

this was the original one

case 55://Action after case 54 c.getPA().enterRFD(); c.talkingNpc = -1; c.getPA().removeAllWindows(); for(int p = 0; p < c.PRAYER.length; p++) { c.prayerActive[p] = false; c.getPA().sendFrame36(c.PRAYER_GLOW[p], 0); } break;

And this is the one that sk8erdude gave me

if(c.dialogueAction == 101){ c.getPA().enterRFD(); c.talkingNpc = -1; c.getPA().removeAllWindows(); for(int p = 0; p < c.PRAYER.length; p++) { c.prayerActive[p] = false; c.getPA().sendFrame36(c.PRAYER_GLOW[p], 0); } }

Or do you need this one its in playerassistant.java

public void enterRFD() { if (c.Culin == true) { c.sendMessage("You have already finished this minigame!"); return; } if (c.Agrith == true && c.Flambeed == false) { c.waveId = 1; c.getPA().movePlayer(1899,5363, c.playerId * 4+2); Server.rfd.spawnNextWave(c); return; } if(c.Flambeed == true && c.Karamel == false) { c.waveId = 2; c.getPA().movePlayer(1899,5363, c.playerId * 4+2); Server.rfd.spawnNextWave(c); return; } if(c.Karamel == true && c.Dessourt == false) { c.waveId = 3; c.getPA().movePlayer(1899,5363, c.playerId * 4+2); Server.rfd.spawnNextWave(c); return; } if(c.Dessourt == true && c.Culin == false) { c.waveId = 4; c.getPA().movePlayer(1899,5363, c.playerId * 4+2); Server.rfd.spawnNextWave(c); return; } if (c.Agrith == false) { c.getPA().movePlayer(1899,5363, c.playerId * 4+2); c.waveId = 0; c.RFDToKill = -1; c.RFDKilled = -1; Server.rfd.spawnNextWave(c); } }

Read full topic

item.title: Fixxed
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“nickskeee, post:11, topic:533674”]Okay i got the dialogue working i readed something wrong back in your comments :s
but where do i put the second part in clickingbuttons.java ?[/quote]
under the switch, i think it’s case 9157 for the first line of a 2 line chat interface, and case 9158 for the second line.
You’ll want to add something like:

if(c.dialogueAction == 101){ c.getPA().enterRFD(); c.talkingNpc = -1; c.getPA().removeAllWindows(); for(int p = 0; p < c.PRAYER.length; p++) { c.prayerActive[p] = false; c.getPA().sendFrame36(c.PRAYER_GLOW[p], 0); } }

item.title: Fixxed
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Okay. Let me start over.

In your ActionHandler under firstClickNpc, find the code that says:
switch(npcType){

Under that line, you need to add:

case 3386: if (c.Culin) { c.sendMessage("You have already finished this minigame!"); return; } else { c.getDH().sendDialogues(50, npcType); } break;

Only thing you need to remove from the dialogue handler, is this:

case 55://Action after case 54 c.getPA().enterRFD(); c.talkingNpc = -1; c.getPA().removeAllWindows(); for(int p = 0; p < c.PRAYER.length; p++) { c.prayerActive[p] = false; c.getPA().sendFrame36(c.PRAYER_GLOW[p], 0); } break;

And have it handled in ClickingButtons.java

Read full topic

item.title: Fixxed
item.dc:creator: @nickskeee nickskeee
item.description:
@nickskeee wrote:

i didnt have the firstclicknpc so i made it and put the code under that like this

public void firstClickNpc(int npcType) { case 50: sendPlayerChat1("Who the hell are you?!"); c.nextChat = 52; c.dialogueAction = 100; break; case 52: sendNpcChat4("I have sets of powerful gloves. You can", "unlock differnt pairs if you participate", "in my game. Are you interested?", "", c.talkingNpc, "Gypsy"); c.nextChat = 53; break; case 53: sendOption2("Yes, i'll play your game.", "No, thanks."); c.dialogueAction = 101; break; case 54: sendPlayerChat1("Yes, i'll play your game."); c.nextChat = 55; break; case 55://Action after case 4 c.getPA().enterRFD(); c.talkingNpc = -1; c.getPA().removeAllWindows(); for(int p = 0; p < c.PRAYER.length; p++) { c.prayerActive[p] = false; c.getPA().sendFrame36(c.PRAYER_GLOW[p], 0); } break; }
and when i compile it said

public void firstClickNpc(int npcType) { case 50: sendPlayerChat1("Who the hell are you?!"); c.nextChat = 52; c.dialogueAction = 100; break; case 52: sendNpcChat4("I have sets of powerful gloves. You can", "unlock differnt pairs if you participate", "in my game. Are you interested?", "", c.talkingNpc, "Gypsy"); c.nextChat = 53; break; case 53: sendOption2("Yes, i'll play your game.", "No, thanks."); c.dialogueAction = 101; break; case 54: sendPlayerChat1("Yes, i'll play your game."); c.nextChat = 55; break; case 55://Action after case 4 c.getPA().enterRFD(); c.talkingNpc = -1; c.getPA().removeAllWindows(); for(int p = 0; p < c.PRAYER.length; p++) { c.prayerActive[p] = false; c.getPA().sendFrame36(c.PRAYER_GLOW[p], 0); } break; }

And case 55 should it be putted in actionhandler then ?

item.title: Fixxed
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

This:

case 55://Action after case 54 c.getPA().enterRFD(); c.talkingNpc = -1; c.getPA().removeAllWindows(); for(int p = 0; p < c.PRAYER.length; p++) { c.prayerActive[p] = false; c.getPA().sendFrame36(c.PRAYER_GLOW[p], 0); } break;
should never be done. You only handle dialogues in the dialogue handler. That’s the point of the dialogue ID’s and such…

"I changed the code but now when i compile is says"
Makes me think you put it in the wrong area of your action handler…

In mine I have:

public void firstClickNpc(int npcType) {
and lower:

		switch (npcType) {
		case 380://Customs officer (Female)
			c.getDH().sendDialogues(100, npcType);
			break;

Read full topic

item.title: Fixxed
item.dc:creator: @nickskeee nickskeee
item.description:
@nickskeee wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:533674”][quote author=nickskeee link=topic=652469.msg4371952#msg4371952 date=1380918710]

Which npc isn’t working. You just posted code for more than one, let alone for different dialogues…

It’s gypsy like it is saying in the first code "case 3386"
and i dont understand what u mean with "You just posted code for more than one, let alone for different dialogues…"
Thanks
[/quote]
If it’s only for case 3386, then why did you post 2403’s?
That’s what I was saying, you’ve posted for more than one npc.

Anyways, you don’t need c.npcType since the npcType is defined in firstClickNpc (or second, third, etc).
So your ‘new’ code looks like:

case 3386: if (c.Culin) { c.sendMessage("You have already finished this minigame!"); return; } else { c.getDH().sendDialogues(50, npcType); } break;
Other than that, it looks fine. Only thing I can think of is you put it in the wrong spot in your ActionHandler.

Also, what is the point of this dialogue:

case 54: sendPlayerChat1("Yes, i'll play your game."); c.nextChat = 55; break;[/quote]

it’s only about the 3386 case sorry didn’t notice
after case 54 it teleports me to RFD minigame

case 55://Action after case 54 c.getPA().enterRFD(); c.talkingNpc = -1; c.getPA().removeAllWindows(); for(int p = 0; p < c.PRAYER.length; p++) { c.prayerActive[p] = false; c.getPA().sendFrame36(c.PRAYER_GLOW[p], 0); } break;

I changed the code but now when i compile is says

[code]src\server\model\players\ActionHandler.java:569: error: cannot find symbol
c.getDH().sendDialogues(50, npcType);
^
symbol: variable npcType
location: class ActionHandler
Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details.
1 error
Druk op een toets om door te gaan. . .

[/code]
Thats why i putted the c. in front of npctype

Read full topic

and i dont understand what u mean with "You just posted code for more than one, let alone for different dialogues…"
Thanks[/quote]
If it’s only for case 3386, then why did you post 2403’s?
That’s what I was saying, you’ve posted for more than one npc.

Anyways, you don’t need c.npcType since the npcType is defined in firstClickNpc (or second, third, etc).
So your ‘new’ code looks like:

case 3386: if (c.Culin) { c.sendMessage("You have already finished this minigame!"); return; } else { c.getDH().sendDialogues(50, npcType); } break;
Other than that, it looks fine. Only thing I can think of is you put it in the wrong spot in your ActionHandler.

Also, what is the point of this dialogue:

case 54: sendPlayerChat1("Yes, i'll play your game."); c.nextChat = 55; break;
